fields.headline: The Guardian graduate jobs email
fields.bodyText: Here is this week's email from The Guardian's graduate section Rise - the next move for young professionals. As usual, we take a look at the best graduate jobs offered by Jobs Unlimited - the website devoted to finding you the best vacancies. For all you newly signed up graduates, one thing to watch out for with this email is the URL links included. All of them work but may be too long for your email format. If they do not work when you click on them, try cutting and pasting the whole URL (weird codes and numbers included) into your internet browser. If you spent most of last Saturday in bed, this is what you missed in LAST WEEK'S RISE (Saturday 24 February). Hilary Freeman asked the hitherto unasked question: are overweight graduates being overlooked in the work place? The obese not only find it hard to get that first job, but also progress less quickly. http://jobs.theguardian.com/rise/feature/0,5190,442194,00.html?bnr=grad.email It also examined whether graduate schemes that send you on a whirlwind tour are a good introduction to the business or a one-way ticket to a state of confusion; and last week's 60 Seconds looked at the police. http://jobs.theguardian.com/rise/feature/0,5190,442198,00.html?bnr=grad.email NEXT WEEK'S RISE looks at the issue of ethical careers. We've got ethical investments and foreign policies, why not ethical careers? We also look at the latest trends in CVs and discuss how to deal with a friend being promoted over your head. This week's RISE GOLD gives some advice on how to get that job that's got your name on it. If at first you don't succeed ... apply, apply again. http://www.theguardian.com/Archive/Article/0,4273,3894896,00.html?bnr=grad.email THIS WEEK'S TOP TIP. Don't be like St Andrews graduate Michelle Simmonds - only the third person to depart from Who Wants to be a Millionaire? without winning a penny. Start reading a paper every day - interviewers are going to want to see a passable general knowledge - it's not too late. THIS WEEK'S HOTTEST JOBS If you are a web-meister extraordinaire, the BBC has the job for you. Its news and sport online technical team is seeking a number of experienced and TRAINEE web producers and software developers to join a growing team. http://jobs.theguardian.com/Browse/Fulltextjob/0,1755,8888105190,00.html?bnr=grad.email If maths and crops are your thing, the Institute of Arable Crops Research has a job that suits that unlikely combo. If you know what Stochastic dynamic models and computer modelling are, the job's probably already yours. http://jobs.theguardian.com/Browse/Fulltextjob/0,1755,8888105104,00.html?bnr=grad.email If you have always wanted to get involved in the Organic movement and have an environmental degree, Sheepdrove Organic Farm is looking for a farm biodiversity officer - it's even got its own barn owls. http://jobs.theguardian.com/Browse/Fulltextjob/0,1755,8888104845,00.html?bnr=grad.email If you are a graduate in teaching or media studies who suddenly yearns for summers off again, Syndenham Hill School in South London wants to put you through its grad training programme - you might have to do a bit of teaching. http://jobs.theguardian.com/Browse/Fulltextjob/0,1755,8888104637,00.html?bnr=grad.email Property information firm IPD is looking for graduates to produce reports into the financial performance of property investments. You'll have a First and experience of quantitative analysis -let's hope they're paying big bucks. http://jobs.theguardian.com/Browse/Fulltextjob/0,1755,8888104114,00.html?bnr=grad.email If you've always wanted to work in children's publishing and for a company with a great name, look no further. Tucker Slingsby is looking for a publishing assistant - it'll be worth it just to answer the phone. http://jobs.theguardian.com/Browse/Fulltextjob/0,1755,8888104079,00.html?bnr=grad.email English heritage has a wicked part-time job for a researcher to be based in London's trendy Clerkenwell. It's only 18 hours per week but you'll be researching the area's rich architectural heritage. £25K pro-rata. http://jobs.theguardian.com/Browse/Fulltextjob/0,1755,8888104047,00.html?bnr=grad.email If you've always thought you were destined to get your hands on some serious gems, www.cooldiamonds.com is looking for a young graduate to help expand its internet diamonds business in Hatton Garden - must have an intimate knowledge of HTML. http://jobs.theguardian.com/Browse/Fulltextjob/0,1755,8888103870,00.html?bnr=grad.email And finally, FTSE big-boy Euromoney Institutional Investor is looking for grad trainee journalists. Candidates should, apparently, have a genuine interest in journalism, a strong academic record and an inquisitive nature. Well you would, wouldn't you http://jobs.theguardian.com/Browse/Fulltextjob/0,1755,8888103851,00.html?bnr=grad.email
